com.tailf.navu

Interface NavuCdbSubscriber

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    NavuCdbConfigSubscriber, NavuCdbOperSubscriber, NavuCdbSubscribers, NavuCdbTwoPhaseSubscriber
    Deprecated.

    @Deprecated
public interface NavuCdbSubscriber
    This interface declares common methods that is mostly implemented by the abstract class NavuCdbSubscribers.

    The methods of this interface specifies method for starting/stopping and registering callback, a user implementation of which is ad hook code that needs to be able to react on Cdb changes.

    A user of this API implements either NavuCdbConfigIterate, for configuration data paths or NavuCdbOperDiffIterate for operational data paths ( CDB oper ) data.

    A user then registers the instance to register method to a subclass of NavuCdbSubscribers (NavuCdbConfigSubscriber or NavuCdbOperSubscriber ).

    • Method Detail

      • awaitRunning

        void awaitRunning()
                  throws InterruptedException
        Deprecated. 
        Blocks the calling thread until this NavuCdbSubscriber is in a running state.

        The method subscriberStart() starts the NavuCdbSubscriber asynchronously. If it is desired to wait until the NavuCdbSubscriber is running the calling thread calls this method will block until it is running state.

        When a NavuCdbSubscriber starts it needs to do some processing work before it could read the underlying Cdb socket for notifications. This method is useful when we which to know when the NavuCdbSubscriber is reading the underlying Cdb socket for notification.

        If the NavuCdbSubscriber is already running upon invocation of this method the calling thread will return immediately.

        Throws:
        InterrupedException - if the waiting process got interrupted
        InterruptedException

      • awaitStopped

        void awaitStopped()
                  throws InterruptedException
        Deprecated. 
        Blocks the calling thread until this subscriber have stopped.

        The subscriber is stopped when it is not running.

        The method subscriberStop() stops the NavuCdbSubscriber asynchronously. If it is desired to wait until the NavuCdbSubscriber have stopped i.e when the subscriber has released its internal resources and it is ready for a restart this method will block the calling thread until the subscriber is in a stopped state.

        Throws:
        InterrupedException - if the waiting process got interrupted
        InterruptedException

      • executor

        ExecutorService executor()
        Deprecated. 
        Retrieve the underlying ExecutorService of this subscriber.

        If the underlying ExecutorService have been shutdown the subscriber can no longer be started.

        Returns:
        The ExecutorService for this subscriber

      • getIterationQueue

        NavuCdbSubscriptionIterQueue getIterationQueue()
        Deprecated. 
        Retrieve a iteration (notification) blocking queue where iteration information from each made iteration could be received.

        For each iteration of a diff entry the queue receives summary information. For example of such information is a subscription point, path , oper flag ,result flag returned from user provided callback for particular iteration.

        Returns:
        notification queue where there is ability to retrieve a notification entry on each iteration.

      • isRunning

        boolean isRunning()
        Deprecated. 
        Return true if this subscriber is running.
        Returns:
        true/false whether this subscriber is running

      • isStopped

        boolean isStopped()
        Deprecated. 
        Return true if this subscriber is stopped.
        Returns:
        true/false whether this subscriber is stopped

      • registerStoppedHandler

        void registerStoppedHandler(NavuCdbStoppedHandler handler)
        Deprecated. 
        Register callback which will be invoked on subscriber shutdown event.
        Parameters:
        handler - A register handler upon shutdown event by ConfD/NCS

      • shutDownOnException

        void shutDownOnException(boolean shutdownonexc)
        Deprecated. 
        Controls the shutdown behavior of this subscriber when the subscriber receives a uncaught exception from one of its registered callbacks.

        When a user callback throws unexpected exception that is not caught by the callback the default behavior for a NavuCdbConfigSubscriber is to sync with CdbSubscriptionSyncType.DONE_SOCKET and stops the subscriber and shutdown the underlying ExecutorService.

        This method defines if the subscriber should stop when an uncaught exception from callback is thrown.

        Parameters:
        shutdownonexc - true/false whether this subscriber should stop after a uncaught exception from one of the set of callbacks is thrown.

      • subscriberStart

        boolean subscriberStart()
        Deprecated. 
        Starts a NavuCdbSubscriber asynchronously, if the NavuCdbConfigSubscriber is not already been started.

        After all the registration have been done the subscriber must be started which submits this subscriber to the underlying ExecutorService

        Returns true if this subscriber was successfully started false if the subscriber was already started or is running.

        This method is thread safe only one thread at a time could start the NavuCdbSubscriber and receive true from this method. Multiple invocations of this method will return false if this NavuCdbSubscriber was already started.

        Returns:
        true/false indicating if this runnable was successfully submitted to the underlying ExecutorService.

      • subscriberStop

        boolean subscriberStop()
        Deprecated. 
        Sends a Stop signal to the underlying subscription process without shutting down the underlying ExecutorService.

        If the subscriber is already stopped this method return false. This makes it possible to restart the Subscriber with subscriberStart().

        Returns:
        true if the sending of the stop signal was successful. and false if the process of waiting before subscription process was interrupted.
